classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, D2, E, and GE Elective. Upper-Division C and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C1, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, or E.

Any free elective can go here.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.

Select from the following: BRAE340, BRAE345, BRAE532; ERSC303, ERSC323, ERSC442, ERSC443; GEOL241; NR260, NR315, NR339, NR400, NR413, NR418, NR422, NR474; NR/BIO/SS 421; NR/CRP 408; PHYS107; SS431, SS440; STAT313.

If a course is taken to meet a major requirement, it cannot be double-counted as an approved elective for the concentration. Consultation with advisor is recommended prior to selecting approved electives; bear in mind your selections may impact pursuit of post-baccalaureate studies and/or goals.
